result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward S Kerchefski III

defendant.name: Kerchefski, Edward S, III
defendant.address: c/o Rusk County Jail, Ladysmith, WI 54848

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 26, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter dated 6/28/22 from DOC concerning PSI Order

10:03 AM Defendant Edward S Kerchefski III appeared by video.  Attorney Michelle Erdman appeared by video for Edward S Kerchefski III.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 19CT22, 21CF92, 22CF32, 22CF36.  

2019CT22-DAGP revoked, enter sentence.

2021CF92-Ct 1.  Ct's 2,3 will be DRI.

22CF32-Amended Ct 1.  Ct's 2,3,4 DRI.

22CF36-Ct's 5,6.  Ct's 1-4 will be DRI.

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of NC to charges, finds DE guilty.  Court will order a PSI be prepared in CF cases. Set for Sentencing October 4, 2022 @ 3:00PM.  PSI to be filed 2 weeks prior to sentencing date. Adj 10:27am.
Sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:58 PM Defendant Edward S Kerchefski III appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Edward S Kerchefski III.  Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 2022CF32, 2022CF36, 21CF92. Offer has been presented to parties.  Set for Plea/Sentencing June 21, 2022 @ 10:00AM, ZOOM. Adj 4:01PM
Review hearing on May 16, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

01:49 PM Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court, defendant Edward S Kerchefski in court, in custody.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for Edward S Kerchefski.  Hearing along with 22CF36.  DE has a copy of the information, and understands.  Waiving reading of Information and enter a plea of NG.  Court sets review hearing for 5/16/22 at  4:00PM via Zoom for both cases.

11:30 AM - Time set for RH in case 21CF92 and PH in case 22CF32, 22CF36. Defendant Edward S Kerchefski appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video means for Defendant Edward S Kerchefski. (Attorney Galen Bayne-Allison not in court for case 21CF92, this will need to be rescheduled with Atty Bayne-Allison)  22CF36 PH will be waived, DE agrees.  The Court explains to DE what it means to waive the PH in this matter.  Atty Nelson appears in court for the State of WI.  Court finds waiver to be knowingly, intelligently, freely voluntarily made.  Will bind over case 22CF36.  22CF32 - State calls Kevin Julien, oath given. State, direct.  Court questions DE if he'll waive his in person appearance for case 22CF32.  He agrees to waive his in person appearance.   There is a bond on file, court will receive the certified bond that is on file.  Witness released - 11:51 a.m.  State gives their argument.  Erdman gives her argument - 11:52 a.m.  Court does overview of this matter for the record - 11:53 p.m.  Court finds there is was a crime committed, will bind over for trial.  Set for arraignment on 4/8 @ 1:30 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on March 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

02:20 PM Defendant Edward S Kerchefski in court with attorney Michelle M Erdman.  Defendant Edward S Kerchefski in custody.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward S Kerchefski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Heard along with 22CF32, 22CF36.    Waive formal reading of the CC.  DE wishes to have his PH as soon as possible or have his cash bond over all his cases or be released on sign bond.  Set for PH March 16, 2022 @ 11:30am.  21CF92-SP does not appear. Adj 2:24pm
COS of Summons/Complaint served to Edward Kerchefski III by Deputy D Hraban
